intro: Caballeroa ifniensis, commonly known as the Ifni caballeroa, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk. Caballeroa ifniensis is known for its resilience to coastal conditions and is of interest to botanists studying Mediterranean flora.
